Channel codes

name: Climate vulnerability
description: Global adaptation index score of each country's vulnerability to climate change, incorporating exposure, sensitivity and ability to adapt to the negative impacts of climate change. Higher scores indicate higher vulnerability to climate change.
source: Notre Dame Global Adaptation Index (ND-GAIN) vulnerability score

name: % of workforce employed in agriculture
description: % of workforce employed in agriculture

description: Percentage employment in agriculture, industry & services

description: % of workforce employed in industry

name: % of workforce employed in services
description: % of workforce employed in services
ISO-3166 Alpha-2 country codes

name: Foreign direct investment per person
description: Foreign direct investment per person (note that negative values, which occur when disinvestment exceeds new investments, are set to zero)
source: Development Initiatives calculations based on UNCTAD and World Bank

name: Fragile states
description: Fragile states classifications in 2014
source: Development Initiatives calculations based on the fragile states index
calculation: Very fragile countries are those that have been considered 'very high warning' for each of the last 10 years and have been considered 'very high alert at least twice; long-term fragile states are those which have been considered 'very high warning' for all of the last 10 years; fragile countries are those considered 'high warning' or above in 2014; improving fragility are those that have been considered fragile in at least 3 of the last 10 years but are no longer fragile

description: GDP (Current US$)

name: Gross National Income (2005 US$)
description: GDP (Constant 2005 US$)

name: Gross National Income (current US$)
description: GNI (Current US$)

name: Government spending per person (2011 PPP$)
description: Government spending per person, 2011 PPP$, net of general budget support ODA and disbursements on debt to the public sector
source: Development Initiatives, based on IMF WEO, OECD DAC, World Bank
calculation: Calculated from IMF WEO data on government spending as a proportion of GDP. Receipts of general budget support ODA and disbursements on public debt are subtracted from total government spending before dividing by the population, to avoid double counting when comparing with international resource flows.

name: Government spending
description: Total government spending, 2012 USD, net of general budget support ODA and disbursements on debt to the public sector
source: Development Initiatives, based on IMF WEO, OECD DAC, World Bank
calculation: Calculated from IMF WEO data on government spending as a proportion of GDP. Receipts of general budget support ODA and disbursements on public debt are subtracted from total government spending to avoid double counting when comparing with international resource flows.

name: Human hazard exposure score
description: Index for risk management score for exposure to human hazards (10 = high exposure)

description: Share of income of bottom 20% of population

columns: id, year, income-share-bottom-20pc, income-share-second-20pc, income-share-third-20pc, income-share-fourth-20pc, income-share-highest-20pc
description: Percentage of income recieved by each quintile of the population

description: Share of income of top 10% of population

name: Infant mortality rate (per 1,000 live births)
description: Infant mortality rate (per 1,000 live births)

name: Total international resource flows
description: Total international resource flows received
source: Development Initiatives calculations based on numerous sources
calculation: Is the sum of net inflows of FDI, remittances, gross ODA, gross OOFs, portfolio equity, net inflows of short-term debt, long-term debt, humanitarian assistance and peacekeeping. This series aims to estimate gross inflows so negative net inflows are excluded (set to zero). Data on peacekeeping is only available for 2012 and humanitarian assistance (excluding that reported as ODA to the OECD DAC) is only available from 2000-2012.

name: International resource flows to and from developing countries
columns: id, year, direction, flow-type, flow-name, value
description: Details on each resource flow to and from developing countries
source: Development Initiatives calculations based on numerous sources

name: International resources flows from donors to developing countries
columns: id, year, direction, flow-type, flow-name, value
description: Details on each resource flow to and from developing countries
source: Development Initiatives calculations based on numerous sources

name: Humanitarian assistance
description: Humanitarian assistance to each country (including HA reported as ODA)
source: Development Initiatives based on OECD DAC, UN OCHA FTS and UN CERF

name: Largest international resource flow to each country
description: The largest international resource flow to each country in each year
source: Development Initiatives calculations based on numerous sources

name: Poverty gap at $1.25 day
description: Poverty gap is the mean shortfall from the poverty line (counting the nonpoor as having zero shortfall), expressed as a percentage of the poverty line. This measure reflects the depth of poverty as well as its incidence.

name: Poverty gap at $2 day
description: Poverty gap is the mean shortfall from the poverty line (counting the nonpoor as having zero shortfall), expressed as a percentage of the poverty line. This measure reflects the depth of poverty as well as its incidence.
